page.title: 09Churches and Chapels
page.content: In Tean there are four denominational places of worship.Christ Church in Hollington Road is the C. of E. Church. It was built of Hollington stone in 1843 when Tean became a separate parish from Checkley. Close by the Church is a modern Church Hall and Vicarage. St Thomas of Canterbury is the R.C. Church. Built of brick in 1938 it is in St Thomas' Road. Before the Church was built, the Old School by the side of the present Church was used for services.The Methodist Chapel is situated at the junction of Old Road and New Road.Although well supported, there is not a resident Minister. The Chapel is in need of repair because of damage caused by heavy traffic passing cose by.
